summary: This is an internal FBI email from a Public Affairs Specialist in New York, forwarding a news article link about alleged Epstein victims recounting their emotions after witnessing the financier's arrest. The email notes that many outlets picked up the same interview and mentions a Today Show interview.

persons.name: Public Affairs Specialist FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the internal FBI email, forwarding news clips about alleged Epstein victims and noting media coverage.

events.title: Media Coverage of Epstein Victims' Reactions
events.description: Multiple news outlets, including ABC News and the Today Show, run interviews with alleged Epstein victims recounting their powerful emotions after witnessing the financier's arrest.
personsInvolved: Public Affairs Specialist FBI New York

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email dated July 10, 2019, concerning media coverage of the Epstein case.
It references news interviews where alleged Epstein victims described their emotional reactions to witnessing his arrest.
The email notes that many outlets picked up the same victim interview, along with a separate Today Show interview that morning.
The sender, an FBI Public Affairs Specialist in New York, indicates they will continue searching for coverage as they see different names.
